text: well this is the heart of Russia's
military operation in Syria the main
meum airbase which is about half an
hour's drive from the port town of
Latakia and for six weeks now Russian
bombers have been taking off from here
they've been locating targets and
carrying out airstrikes across Syria the
operation has been going on pretty much
round-the-clock a steady stream of
planes taking off and landing day and
night here this is Earth Sukhoi 30 which
is in the process of refuelling there
are three different military planes that
the Russians have been using to carry
out their airstrikes now Moscow says
that the whole point of its operation is
to destroy terrorists in Syria before
terrorists can come to Russia and carry
out attacks on Russian soil in other
words to make to boost Russians national
security Western governments paint a
different picture they suspect that
Moscow's aim is to bolster President
Assad and strengthen Russian influence
in the Middle East we're in another part
of the base now and a military jet is
about to land after six weeks of air
strikes there's no end in sight to this
operation
Russia's war on terror continues Steve
Rosenberg BBC news at the Russian air
base in Syria
